title: A Massacre That Rippled Through Generations in Thailand
description: For the parents and the grandparents of the children who were killed as they slept at a rural day care, coming to terms with the tragedy has been an impossible task.

title: Whirring Into Action in Ukraine’s Skies
description: Against the odds, Ukraine’s helicopter brigades are not only still operational, but are an inspirational component of its war effort.

title: Station Manager in Greek Train Crash Faces Court
description: Rail workers say that a key signal light was always stuck on red, and that station managers only warned one another of oncoming trains via walkie-talkie.

title: Provincial Governor Is Fatally Shot in the Philippines
description: Three men have been arrested in the attack on Gov. Roel Degamo, who died on Saturday along with five citizens who had been meeting with him.

title: Old Skills, New Rewards
description: There are so many good reasons to return to hobbies and activities that gave us joy when we were younger, as these reader stories show.

title: Fight for Ukrainian City of Bakhmut Becomes a Battle Over Roads
description: Ukraine’s military said that Russia was continuing its efforts to encircle the city but that it had beaten back several attacks.

title: Canada Knows China Tried to Meddle in Its Elections, but What Should Come Next?
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has rejected calls by the opposition for a full public inquiry.

title: In West Bank, New Armed Groups Emerge, and Dormant Ones Stir
description: The small but influential Lions’ Den network has attracted young Palestinians disappointed by their leaders and angry at Israeli violence. Veteran fighters are restless, too.

title: They Shared Erotic Images in a Group Chat. The Fine: $17,000.
description: A couple in Singapore created a Telegram account where they posted risqué content for subscribers. They were convicted of violating nudity and obscenity laws.

title: Italy Shipwreck Kills Soccer Player from Pakistan
description: Shahida Raza, a national soccer and field hockey player, wanted her disabled son to have a better life. The boat carrying her to Italy crashed just off the coast.

title: The Woman Shaking Up Italian Politics (No, Not the New Prime Minister)
description: Daughter of Italian and Jewish American parents, Elly Schlein wants to remake the center-left opposition to Giorgia Meloni, if only her party can survive it.

title: Diplomat Who Faced Brexit Freeze in U.K. Now Sees a ‘New Beginning’
description: As the European Union’s first ambassador in London, João Vale de Almeida had to fight even for official recognition. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and the Windsor Framework are changing things, he says.

title: What to Expect at China’s National People’s Congress as Xi Tightens Grip
description: When its top legislature meets, Beijing will lay out a vision for reviving economic growth and strengthening the Communist Party’s grip after a chaotic reopening.

title: Biden and Germany’s Scholz Meet Amid Concerns Over Ukraine and China
description: President Biden said he and Germany’s chancellor, Olaf Scholz, would work in “lock step” to provide military support to Ukraine.

title: As Ukraine Clings to Bakhmut, What’s Its Strategy and What’s at Stake?
description: Ukraine is determined to hold the eastern city as long as it can. How high a price is it willing to pay? What might force its withdrawal? And what would a retreat look like — and mean?
